p: Our analyses of science museums through the emergence of a fourth-generation, and their key drivers, suggest that institutions are evolving, revisiting, and repurposing themselves to become more than they have been historically. The fourth-generation science museum is, in our view, bold, innovative, and forward thinking, and carries possibilities for promoting civic engagement, activism, and change. We recognize that fourth-generation science museums, alongside their critical and agential practices (whether they be exhibitions or other curatorial displays, programs, forums, science cafés, outreach, coalitions, and community work), carry their own set of challenges and narratives, particularly when approaching controversy. However, the time for change has come.
